test_cases.name: Verify successful creation of a formula-based metric with weekly cadence and addition to dashboard
preconditions: The application is available at the specified base URL.
A valid user account exists with the provided credentials and has permissions to create metrics and edit dashboards for the specified company.
Two pre-existing metrics, required for the formula, are available in the system for the specified company.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the Application URL: https://alignwebdev.aligntoday.com/
test_steps.expected_result: The login page is displayed successfully.

test_steps.action: Enter the user's email address from the test data and click the 'Continue' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The password input field is displayed.

test_steps.action: Enter the user's password from the test data and click the 'Login' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The company selection page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Select the specified company from the list.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is successfully logged in and redirected to the company's dashboard page.

test_steps.action: Verify the dashboard page is displayed after company selection.
test_steps.expected_result: The main dashboard, including the navigation menu, is visible.

test_steps.action: Click on 'Metrics' in the navigation menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Metrics' page is loaded and displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Add Metric' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric creation form opens.

test_steps.action: Enter the metric name from the test data into the 'Name' input field.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric name is entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Enter the current value for the metric from the test data into the 'Current Value' input field.
test_steps.expected_result: The current value is entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Select 'Formula' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Formula Builder' interface becomes visible below the dropdown.

test_steps.action: Verify the 'Formula Builder' interface is visible.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Search Metric' input field, operator buttons, and formula display area are all visible.

test_steps.action: In the 'Search Metric' input field, search for and select the first metric specified in the test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected first metric appears in the formula display area.

test_steps.action: Click the operator button specified in the test data (e.g., '+').
test_steps.expected_result: The selected operator appears in the formula display area next to the first metric.

test_steps.action: In the 'Search Metric' input field, search for and select the second metric specified in the test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected second metric appears in the formula display area, completing the formula.

test_steps.action: Verify the complete formula is displayed correctly in the format: (Metric) [Operator] (Metric).
test_steps.expected_result: The formula is displayed as expected, and a green checkmark button is visible.

test_steps.action: Select 'Weekly' from the 'Cadence' dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Resets On' dropdown field appears on the form.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Resets On' dropdown and select the day specified in the test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected day is displayed in the 'Resets On' field.

test_steps.action: Click the green checkmark button to confirm the formula.
test_steps.expected_result: The formula is accepted without errors.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
test_steps.expected_result: A success confirmation is received, and the user is returned to the metrics list page.

test_steps.action: Navigate to 'My Dashboard' via the navigation menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The main dashboard page is displayed, and the 'My KPIs' section is visible.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Edit KPI' icon within the 'My KPIs' section.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Edit KPI' modal opens, showing available metrics on the left and selected KPIs on the right.

test_steps.action: Search for the newly created metric name in the modal's search field.
test_steps.expected_result: The list of available metrics is filtered to show the newly created metric.

test_steps.action: Locate the metric in the left panel of available metrics.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric is found and is visible in the left panel.

test_steps.action: Click the metric in the left panel.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric is automatically moved to the right panel of selected KPIs.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button in the modal.
test_steps.expected_result: The modal closes, and the dashboard refreshes.

test_steps.action: Verify the new metric is visible in the 'My KPIs' section on the dashboard.
test_steps.expected_result: The newly created metric is displayed in the 'My KPIs' section with its correct name and current value.

test_steps.action: Locate the metric in the left panel of available metrics.

test_steps.action: Click the metric in the left panel.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric is automatically moved to the right panel of selected KPIs.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button in the modal.
test_steps.expected_result: The modal closes, and the dashboard refreshes.

test_steps.action: Verify the new metric is visible in the 'My KPIs' section on the dashboard.
test_steps.expected_result: The newly created metric is displayed in the 'My KPIs' section with its correct name and current value.

test_cases.name: Verify end-to-end flow of creating and adding 3 different metrics to the dashboard in a single session
preconditions: The application is available at the specified base URL.
A valid user account exists with the provided credentials and has permissions to create metrics and edit dashboards.
An Excel file with exactly 3 valid data rows for metric creation is accessible.
All pre-existing metrics required by the data rows (for 'Formula' or 'Metric' value sources) exist in the application.

test_data.note: The test data for each of the 3 metrics is sourced from the specified Excel file. Example data for the 3 rows could be: Row 1 (Formula, Weekly), Row 2 (Metric, Monthly), Row 3 (Formula, Quarterly).

test_steps.action: Navigate to the Application URL: https://alignwebdev.aligntoday.com/
test_steps.expected_result: The login page is displayed successfully.

test_steps.action: Enter the user's email and password from the test data and complete the login process.
test_steps.expected_result: The company selection page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Select the specified company from the list.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is successfully logged in and redirected to the company's dashboard page.

test_steps.action: Verify successful navigation to the dashboard.
test_steps.expected_result: The main dashboard, including the navigation menu and 'My KPIs' section, is visible.

test_steps.action: --- START METRIC 1 CREATION (Data from Excel Row 1) --- Navigate to the 'Metrics' page via the navigation menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Metrics' page is loaded and displayed.

test_steps.action: Execute the complete metric creation and dashboard addition flow for the first record from the Excel file (e.g., a Formula-based, Weekly metric).
test_steps.expected_result: The first metric is created successfully without errors.

test_steps.action: Navigate to 'My Dashboard' and add the first newly created metric to the 'My KPIs' section.
test_steps.expected_result: The first metric is visible in the 'My KPIs' section on the dashboard.

test_steps.action: --- START METRIC 2 CREATION (Data from Excel Row 2) --- Without logging out, navigate back to the 'Metrics' page.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Metrics' page is displayed, and the user session remains active.

test_steps.action: Execute the complete metric creation and dashboard addition flow for the second record from the Excel file (e.g., a Metric-based, Monthly metric).
test_steps.expected_result: The second metric is created successfully, and the creation form was reset correctly from the previous entry.

test_steps.action: Navigate to 'My Dashboard' and add the second newly created metric to the 'My KPIs' section.
test_steps.expected_result: The second metric is now visible in the 'My KPIs' section alongside the first metric.

test_steps.action: --- START METRIC 3 CREATION (Data from Excel Row 3) --- Without logging out, navigate back to the 'Metrics' page.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Metrics' page is displayed, and the user session remains active.

test_steps.action: Execute the complete metric creation and dashboard addition flow for the third record from the Excel file (e.g., a Formula-based, Quarterly metric).
test_steps.expected_result: The third metric is created successfully.

test_steps.action: Navigate to 'My Dashboard' and add the third newly created metric to the 'My KPIs' section.
test_steps.expected_result: The third metric is now visible in the 'My KPIs' section alongside the first two metrics.

test_steps.action: Perform a final verification of the 'My KPIs' section on the dashboard.
test_steps.expected_result: All three newly created metrics are correctly displayed in the 'My KPIs' section, each showing its respective name and current value.
